main_definition: When used as an idiom, 'beds' refers to a variety of meanings related to sleeping arrangements or the act of being in bed.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The state of having beds available
meanings_and_examples.example: After renovating their house, they had plenty of nice beds for guests.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A place where one sleeps or rests
meanings_and_examples.example: I spent the whole day in bed due to a cold.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The act of preparing a bed with sheets and blankets for sleeping
meanings_and_examples.example: Every morning, I make my beds before starting the rest of my chores.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A metaphorical expression indicating that many people or things are involved in an activity, similar to a crowded bedroom full of people sleeping
meanings_and_examples.example: During finals week, the library was filled with students' beds as they all studied together.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The state of being overwhelmed by many tasks or commitments, much like an overfilled bed cannot comfortably accommodate everyone
meanings_and_examples.example: After graduation, I felt like my life was full of beds; there were so many responsibilities to take care of.
